title: Job 7:1
text: IS there not an appointed time to man upon earth?  are not his days also like the days of an hireling?

title: Job 7:2
text: As a servant earnestly desireth the shadow, and as an hireling looketh for the reward of his work:

title: Job 7:3
text: So am I made to possess months of vanity, and wearisome nights are appointed to me.

title: Job 7:4
text: When I lie down, I say, When shall I arise, and the night be gone?  and I am full of tossings to and fro unto the dawning of the day.

title: Job 7:5
text: My flesh is clothed with worms and clods of dust; my skin is broken, and become loathsome.

title: Job 7:6
text: My days are swifter than a weaver's shuttle, and are spent without hope.

title: Job 7:7
text: O remember that my life is wind: mine eye shall no more see good.

title: Job 7:8
text: The eye of him that hath seen me shall see me no more: thine eyes are upon me, and I am not.

title: Job 7:9
text: As the cloud is consumed and vanisheth away: so he that goeth down to the grave shall come up no more.

title: Job 7:10
text: He shall return no more to his house, neither shall his place know him any more.

title: Job 7:11
text: Therefore I will not refrain my mouth; I will speak in the anguish of my spirit; I will complain in the bitterness of my soul.

title: Job 7:12
text: Am I a sea, or a whale, that thou settest a watch over me?

title: Job 7:13
text: When I say, My bed shall comfort me, my couch shall ease my complaint;

title: Job 7:14
text: Then thou scarest me with dreams, and terrifiest me through visions:

title: Job 7:15
text: So that my soul chooseth strangling, and death rather than my life.

title: Job 7:16
text: I loathe it; I would not live alway: let me alone; for my days are vanity.

title: Job 7:17
text: What is man, that thou shouldest magnify him?  and that thou shouldest set thine heart upon him?

title: Job 7:18
text: And that thou shouldest visit him every morning, and try him every moment?

title: Job 7:19
text: How long wilt thou not depart from me, nor let me alone till I swallow down my spittle?

title: Job 7:20
text: I have sinned; what shall I do unto thee, O thou preserver of men?  why hast thou set me as a mark against thee, so that I am a burden to myself?

title: Job 7:21
text: And why dost thou not pardon my transgression, and take away mine iniquity?  for now shall I sleep in the dust; and thou shalt seek me in the morning, but I shall not be.
